item.title: Jon add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "Perhaps one did not want to be loved so much as to be understood." -- George Orwell

item.title: Jon add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "Until they became conscious they will never rebel, and until after they have rebelled they cannot become conscious." -- George Orwell

item.title: Jon add a quote by Richard Dawkins
item.description: "We are all atheists about most of the gods that humanity has ever believed in. Some of us just go one god further." -- Richard Dawkins

item.title: Jon add a quote by Enid, in "Ghost World"
item.description: "I don't know...cause I can't stand the idea of a world where a guy like you can't get a date." -- Enid, in "Ghost World"

item.title: Jon add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "There is a theory which states that if ever anyone discovers exactly what the Universe is for and why it is here, it will instantly disappear and be replaced by something even more bizarre and inexplicable. There is another theory which states that this has already happened." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Jon add a quote by Marshall McLuhan
item.description: "I don't necessarily agree with everything that I say." -- Marshall McLuhan

item.title: Jon add a quote by Marshall McLuhan
item.description: "Every society honors its live conformists and its dead troublemakers." -- Marshall McLuhan

item.title: Jon add a quote by Louis D. Brandeis
item.description: "We must make our choice. We may have democracy, or we may have wealth concentrated in the hands of a few, but we cannot have both." -- Louis D. Brandeis

item.title: Jon add a quote by Louis D. Brandeis
item.description: "Most of the things worth doing in the world had been declared impossible before they were done." -- Louis D. Brandeis

item.title: Jon add a quote by John Maynard Keynes
item.description: "The long run is a misleading guide to current affairs. In the long run we are all dead." -- John Maynard Keynes

item.title: Jon add a quote by John Maynard Keynes
item.description: "When my information changes, I alter my conclusions. What do you do, sir?" -- John Maynard Keynes

item.title: Jon add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "All animals are equal, but some animals are more equal than others." -- George Orwell

item.title: Jon add a quote by Paul Wellstone
item.description: "Never separate the life you lead from the words you speak." -- Paul Wellstone

item.title: Jon add a quote by H.L. Mencken
item.description: "The notion that a radical is one who hates his country is naÃ¯ve and usually idiotic. He is, more likely, one who likes his country more than the rest of us, and is thus more disturbed than the rest of us when he sees it debauched. He is not a bad citizen turning to crime; he is a good citizen driven to despair." -- H.L. Mencken

item.title: Jon add a quote by Salman Rushdie
item.description: "What is freedom of expression? Without the freedom to offend, it ceases to exist." -- Salman Rushdie
